titleInfo.subTitle: RELATED ORDER signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 9/29/2009 ORDERING the above cases are related; The action denominated Civ. No. 2:09-cv-2523-FCD-GGH is REASSIGNED to Judge Lawrence K. Karlton and Magistrate Judge John F. Moulds for all further proceedings, and any dates currently set in the reassigned case only, are hereby VACATED; Henceforth, the caption on documents filed in the reassigned case shall be shown as Civ. No. 2:09-cv-2523-LKK-JFM, Civ. No. 2:09-cv-1750-LKK-JFM, and Civ. No. 2:02-325-LKK-JFM, respectively; and the Clerk make shall appropriate adjustment in the assignment of civil cases to compensate for this reassignment.(Matson, R)

titleInfo.title: Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 10/26/10. The court is in receipt of the Notice of Related Cases concerning the above-captioned cases filed October 20, 2010. The court has determined that it is inappropriate to relate or reassign the cases, and therefore declines to do so. This order is issued for informational purposes only, and shall have no effect on the status of the cases, including any previous Related (or Non-Related) Case Order of this court.(Williams, D)

titleInfo.title: Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 5/26/2011 GRANTING IN PART and DENYING IN PART 52, 57 and 58 Motions for Summary Judgment. The court will conduct further proceedings regarding remedy. Within 14 days of the effective date of this order, the parties shall file briefs proposing a process and briefing schedule for use in addressing remedies. (Zignago, K.)

titleInfo.title: Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 6/16/2011 ORDERING that parties will report back to the Court on or before 8/12/2011 to advise the Court on the status of the Parties' discussions; If no agreement appears forthcoming, the Parties will submit a proposed briefing schedule on or before 8/26/2011; Until the Court enters an order addressing remedies, the Forest Service will continue to manage the El Dorado National Forest under the 2010 Motorized Use Vehicle Maps; the Forest Service may continue to exercise its authority to close or restrict uses pursuant to 36 C.F.R. Part 261, Subpart B. (Reader, L)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:09-cv-02523; Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California

Part 261, Subpart B. (Reader, L)

titleInfo.title: Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 8/9/11 ORDERING that the parties shall report on their progress towards reaching an agreement on remedies to address the Court's 5/26/11 Order on or before 9/12/11. If no agreement appears forthcoming, the Parties will submit a proposed briefing schedule. Until the Court enters an order addressing remedies, the Forest Service will continue to manage the Eldorado National Forest under the 2010 Motor Vehicle Use Maps ("2010 MVUMs"), and provide the public with the 2010 MVUMs. Nothing in this order prohibits the Forest Service from exercising its authority to close or restrict uses pursuant to 36 C.F.R. Part 261, Subpart B. (Becknal, R)

Part 261, Subpart B. (Becknal, R)

titleInfo.title: Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 2/23/2012 GRANTING in part plaintiffs' 88 Motion for Partial Vacatur. But it is ONLY to the degree it seeks to set aside that portion of Forest Services decision designating 42 roads through meadows for motorized vehicle traffic. That portion of decision is REMANDED to Forest Service for reconsideration in light of applicable law. The Forest Service directed to submit Proposed Order, no later than 30 days from date of Order, that will set aside only that portion of its decision that designates the 42 roads to degree they go through meadows, and not affecting sections of those same roads that do not go through meadows, unless they cannot otherwise be reached. Plaintiffs and Intervenors shall have 14 days to respond to Proposed Order. Parties have advised Court that 42 roads are currently closed because of seasonal closings. But that seasonal closings end on 3/31/2012. Accordingly, the Forest Service shall EXTEND the seasonal closings of 42 roads until further Order of Court. (Marciel, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:09-cv-02523; Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 2/23/2012 GRANTING in part plaintiffs' 88 Motion for Partial Vacatur. But it is ONLY to the degree it seeks to set aside that portion of Forest Services decision designating 42 roads through meadows for motorized vehicle traffic. That portion of decision is REMANDED to Forest Service for reconsideration in light of applicable law. The Forest Service directed to submit Proposed Order, no later than 30 days from date of Order, that will set aside only that portion of its decision that designates the 42 roads to degree they go through meadows, and not affecting sections of those same roads that do not go through meadows, unless they cannot otherwise be reached. Plaintiffs and Intervenors shall have 14 days to respond to Proposed Order. Parties have advised Court that 42 roads are currently closed because of seasonal closings. But that seasonal closings end on 3/31/2012. Accordingly, the Forest Service shall EXTEND the seasonal closings of 42 roads until further Order of Court. (Marciel, M)

titleInfo.title: Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 7/30/12: The extension of the seasonal closing of the 42 routes issued by this Court on February 14, 2012 106 is hereby vacated. The Court finds that Forest Service has remedied the Endangered Species Act ("ESA") violation, and therefore no further action from the Court is necessary as to the ESA. This Court does not retain further jurisdiction of this matter except to consider any claim for attorney's fees and costs. The Court directs the Clerk to enter final judgment in accordance with Fed. R. Civ. P. 58 and 79. (Kaminski, H)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:09-cv-02523; Center for Sierra Nevada Conservation, et al., v. United States Forest Service, et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 7/30/12: The extension of the seasonal closing of the 42 routes issued by this Court on February 14, 2012 106 is hereby vacated. The Court finds that Forest Service has remedied the Endangered Species Act ("ESA") violation, and therefore no further action from the Court is necessary as to the ESA. This Court does not retain further jurisdiction of this matter except to consider any claim for attorney's fees and costs. The Court directs the Clerk to enter final judgment in accordance with Fed. R. Civ. P. 58 and 79. (Kaminski, H)
